Is Water Wet?
  • Contributors

Water. Is. Not. Wet. (Period. Full Stop.)

A guide to the Adjecticular Scale of Liquid Saturation

Get Learning.

Carefully Designed.

We start out with Dry. Dry has a ratio of liquid to object of 

0Liquid:1Object

Moist comes next. Then above it is Damp.


ADV:Wetness:
The word wetness is the descriptor used
to describe an object's physical nature having been changed by a liquid.

Wet

The adjective which primarily describes the threshold of an object's ability to hold a liquid without dripping.

Soggy

Can be dripping, but mostly just at the point where an object is saturated.

Sopping

Definitely dripping at this point. Often made sopping by a Drenched object.

Drenched

As wet as an object can possibly be after coming in contact with a liquid.
